medical_history.chief_complaint: Prosthetic valve endocarditis due to Aspergillus fumigatus.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Approximately 2 months after completing treatment for Streptococcus mitis aortic valve endocarditis, the patient experienced a focal seizure involving his left arm. MRI revealed numerous small hemorrhagic strokes and a cerebral angiogram showed a mycotic aneurysm. He noted acute loss of vision in his right eye following treatment initiation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Recent history of Streptococcus mitis aortic valve endocarditis; underwent aortic root replacement with a bioprosthesis and completed treatment with ceftriaxone.
medical_history.social_history: Reported using intranasal heroin daily for the previous 6 months; ceased all illicit drug use after the initial treatment.
